bio: Building the Single Source of Truth (SSoT) for Crypto with Reference Data
contributionDescription:
We have covered Optimism’s reference data and provided a holistic view of Optimism’s protocols in MetaMosaic.
Metamosaic is a platform for blockchain reference data, where everyone(especially developers and researchers) can access protocol-centric metadata, classifications, and relation graphs with API and Explorer. It analyzes on-chain protocol life-cycle activities and off-chain protocol information to put the puzzle back together. And it provides detailed relationships between protocols, smart contracts, deployers, contract creator wallets, related addresses, etc.

contributionLinks.description: App Directory with reference data is a use case product of MetaMosaic.

impactDescription:
Optimism developers can very easily and for free use the Reference data API port to build their products. As well as all community users can view and use Reference data to stay in control with trusted, validated blockchain reference data in one place.
For example, in terms of Security, you can access comprehensive detection through wide data coverage and relational mapping; and for Money Flow, you can find out exactly what a transaction has done and discover deeper insights.

bio: UFO is an onchain radio network and club for music, arts and ideas.
contributionDescription:
In one year, UFO has grown from 0 subscribers to 9K on Base, 31K on Lens, 14K on Mirror, 16K on X, 6K on Zora by experimenting with onchain media, mostly in the OP ecosystem. Many of our 41 podcasts with founders, builders and artists have focused on the OP ecosystem.

We are assembling an onchain radio network with partners incl. Zora, Base, Mirror, Lens Protocol, Bonfire, Interface, Lore, Coinvise, XMTP and Paragraph. The build will be open source.

NOV 11, UFO Genesis Pass on Mirror with 7812 mints. Top 5 for collects on Mirror (OP)

JUN 27, first podcast to mint our catalog to an 1155 on Zora network with 5370 total mints

AUG 30, FM TOUR for onchain summer with Base and Bonfire with 8889 mints

OCT 23, UFO was among the first to mint a Paragraph newsletter on Zora network
impactDescription:
By being early and experimenting in onchain media and web3 social, we have the DMs to show we have inspired media and community strategies for Nouns Builder projects, publications, wallets, artist collectives, podcasts, zines, musicians, and creative platforms.

We have demonstrated the effectiveness for media publications to use multiple platforms such as Mirror, Zora, Bonfire and Lens, and across chains including Ethereum, Optimism, Zora and Base. 

We help to amplify the signal for revolutionary ideas, and because we regularly talk about the evolution of onchain media for artists and creatives, many of our 41 podcast episodes have focused on the Optimism ecosystem, particularly via Mirror, Zora and Base.

bio: The Onchain Token Tracker
contributionDescription:
TKN has shipped a decentralized, onchain token tracker protocol, that anyone can suggest changes to, which serves as decentralized public infrastructure for OP tokens. 

Maintaining an online token registry allows TKN to publish a "headless" interface at swp.eth. Example: users can send eth to usdc.swp.eth and $USDC will be automatically returned.

We launched the TKN DAO on Optimism, with a unique token claim structure that doesn't require gas or trust from the user: claim.tkn.xyz/

Products shipped:
(See our full product list in glorious illustrated color: https://giveth.io/project/token-name-service)
- Token subgraph
- Developer API: docs.tkn.xyz/developers/querying-the-tns-dataset
- TokenList: https://tokenlists.org/token-list?url=list.tkn.eth
- Web app

bio: opML, a flexible and performant approach for verifiable onchain ML
contributionDescription: the optimistic approach to onchain AI and machine learning offers significant advantages over existing methods. By embracing this novel approach, we can harness the power of AI while ensuring the integrity and security of the underlying blockchain system. opML, in particular, has shown impressive results in terms of efficiency, scalability, and decentralization, making it an exciting development in the field of AI and blockchain technology. As the use cases for onchain AI expand, it is essential that we continue to explore innovative solutions like opML, which can help us unlock the full potential of these technologies while maintaining the highest standards of transparency, security, and ethical responsibility.
impactDescription: no one has done this. zkML is inefficient. opML provides ML proofs with low cost and high efficiency compared to zkML. The hardware requirements for opML are low: opML can run a large language model, e.g. a 7B-LLaMA (the model size is around 26GB) on a common PC without GPU, while zkML takes around 80 minutes to generate a proof of a 1M-nanoGPT model.

bio: Tripsha helps launch startup cities and other extended community gatherings.
contributionDescription: We built what we believe is the first asynchronous crypto payments system dedicated to event ticketing. We used Optimism as the L2 network of choice for processing registration payments for ZuConnect (Oct 29-Nov 11), the second ever instance of Zuzalu (Vitalik Buterin's startup city). This helped bring awareness of and new users to Optimism. Marine Andraud (a fellow Zuzaluan and Infra Partnership Manager at OP Labs) contributed a helpful onboarding guide on how to pay on Tripsha using Optimism. The way it works is that prospective attendees answer application questions and pre-authorize a token transfer of the amount they need to pay. Event organizers collectively review individual applications, which, if approved, submit the token transfer on chain.

contributionLinks.description: This was the ZuConnect trip page

impactDescription: Brought users, awareness, and an interesting use case of asynchronous crypto payments to Optimism in the community event space, targeting a high quality group of crypto early adopters and other applicants to Vitalik Buterin's startup city. It created an educational point for those who hadn't already experienced Optimism or using an L2 before.

bio: AI Assistant for Optimism Governance
contributionDescription:
When it comes to Optimism governance, there are too many sources to keep up with even for a governance nerd - let alone an average user. All of a sudden you might be out of the loop and finding the answers to your questions becomes quite a hassle. Well, not anymore, Glaucon has the answers.

Web widget: Glaucon is available as a web widget that can be embedded to any website for free by adding 2 lines of code. 
Webhook: Glaucon has a webhook url which enables usage in any app if they need something beyond a simple web widget
Telegram Bot: This bot is probably the easiest way to talk to Glaucon, feedback for this integration was very positive as telegram is quite popular among web3 users
Slack Bot: Glaucon is also available for teams that want to have it as a bot on their slack workspaces
impactDescription:
Glaucon made navigating the Optimism governance resources much more easier using specific knowledge bases and evolving with user feedback. Glaucon has a flow where each question it's unable to answers gets recorded in a table, which are later evaluated to determine whether or not they are relevant to this project's scope. 

With this approach, hundreds of questions were collected step by step, and so far 10+ knowledge bases are connected to cover everything users are curious about. Rather than trying to start with a perfect product, this process created an application that fits much better to the users' needs.

Currently, as our knowledge bases, we have vectorized data from: OP blogs, optimism docs, (partially) governance forum, (partially) Agora and more

Offer liquidity incentives to attract users for adoption: Provide additional $OP rewards for liquidity providers of OP/ETH, USDC/USDT, sUSD/USDC, DAI/USDC, SNX/ETH, and stETHETH pairs - 2000 users x $1000 x 10% incentive = 144928 OP.
Support for AI Development: We spent 5 months researching the timeseries AI model, attempting to develop an AI model related to cryptocurrency prices. We are currently in the reinforcement learning training phase and need to rent more computational power to provide users with a Uniswap v3 AI price range discovery feature - 1024 GPU x 365 days x $1.562 = 42312 OP

bio: I'M NEW HERE, the definitive feature film about crypto-art and web3 culture
contributionDescription: I’M NEW HERE, by Sundance-winner  Dan Sickles and Oscar-winner Shane Boris, chronicles the rise, fall, and future of the NFT art movement. Aiming to demystify the cryptosphere and celebrate its pioneers, the film has been dubbed "the defining film about Web3 culture" by Raoul Pal. The project also includes NEW HERE SHORTS, an 11-episode artist-profile series, and the “NEWBIE” NFT collection. Designed as an ensemble film, I’M NEW HERE’s story is "decentralized", collating over 100 interviews. Still in post-production for a Fall 2024 release, it blends fiction, live-action, 2D/3D animation, and AI. Through private screenings of both the SHORTS and samples of the feature film, the project has already begun to make waves.

contributionLinks.description: feature film website and also home to NEW HERE NFT collection “NEWBIES”
(pw: hotdogvoodoo) - Link to the staging site for the NEW HERE SHORTS

impactDescription:
Since Spring 2023, the NEW HERE SHORTS and the feature film, unreleased publicly, gained attention through private showings, educating respective audiences of traditional art collectors and film investors about web3.

At NFT.NYC June 2022, we hosted a panel with artists Tyler Hobbs, artnome, and Sarah Zucker. At NFT.NYC April 2023, we screened 2 NEW HERE SHORTS to massive acclaim.

In September 2023, Sundance presented samples from our film at its 200-person investor forum, where we also led panels about web3/AI's future in the industry.

Our NFT "NEWBIES",  have onboarded hundreds to cryptoart, and facilitated ongoing artist collaborations (8 to date).

bio: Onchain governance and access control
contributionDescription:
Llama is an onchain governance and access control product that is deployed on Optimism. 

Using Llama, organizations on Optimism can deploy fully independent instances that define granular roles and permissions for executing transactions, known as "actions".

Llama instances can adapt to a changing environment by incrementally adding new participants and expanding the set of available actions. Actions include transferring funds, updating a registry, changing protocol parameters, or activating an emergency pause.

Llama's onchain framework is open and permissionless: any org on Optimism can deploy a self-governed Llama instance to create and execute onchain actions. 

In addition to action creation, Llama's app helps users view a public audit trail of roles, permissions, and action history.

contributionLinks.description: LlamaFactory contract: deploys Llama instances on Optimism
Llama repository: onchain governance and access control framework (MIT License)
LlamaCore contract: manages action process from creation to execution
LlamaPolicy contract: ERC721 contract that encodes roles and permissions
LlamaAccount contract: manages funds on an organization's Optimism instance

impactDescription:
1. Deployed a novel governance and access control framework on Optimism that solves critical problems relating to granular roles and custom execution strategies that have not been solved by existing systems. Llama helps save engineering resources of protocol teams.

2. Four Llama instances deployed on Optimism, including two by major protocols

3. $100,000 secured by Llama accounts on Optimism

Proxcity is a city simulator game built on the BASE Chain
contributionDescription:
We have released our demo on the Base chain recently and have attracted over 140 unique players to experience blockchain gaming. This involves users signing in via their preferred wallet and receiving achievements, that are NFTs for completing tasks. The goal of the demo was to make a very easy and fun experience for those new to blockchain technology. They learn the basics of connecting their wallet and then being able to interact with their NFTs on their preferred marketplace. On top of this players are having a blast managing their cities that require upkeep daily that brings them back.

There are many plans for the future to keep the game engaging but also attract new users to the Base chain powered by Optimism.

contributionLinks.description: Link to check out the game and play it for free

impactDescription: We are brining new users into the Base ecosystem by building fun, addictive, and engaging experience's with a clean user interface. This is all done free of cost to the user in order to get them familiar with NFTs and the blockchain. The year long development of this project has been entirely funded by the founders.

bio: Blockchain analytics provider working to bring transparency to crypto data
contributionDescription:
Our team has worked on a large variety of projects across Optimism, as well as Superchain projects such as Base. Slice focuses on bringing transparency to crypto data, by providing it in an easy to understand manner to the general public. In turn we help users on Optimism and Base use data driven insights to make decisions.

1. Our OpenIndexer project: 

Every web3 project requires on-chain information. Inspired by BuildOnBase, we decided to create OpenIndexer.

2. Mirror Optimism NFT Tracker

We worked with Mirror to help track all of the subscriber + writing NFTs minted to collectors.

3. Friend.Tech Tooling Dashboards

Our team built out multiple dashboards to help Friend.Tech users trade/purchase new keys with sufficient data to avoid being scammed/rug pulled.

contributionLinks.description: Friend.Tech Alt Account Identifier (Used to avoid Scam Accounts)
Incentive Analysis Stargate (Paid Job) - Use only as a reference for our work.

impactDescription:
Our team has provided countless data driven insights/custom queries to companies, DAO's, and individuals in the crypto space. These insights have helped the Optimism & Base communities by providing helpful data in an easy to understand manner. This driving adoption to new protocols built within the collective.

Our team is one of the leading providers of data and tooling on Friend.Tech where our dashboards are visited daily by users looking to understand FT in a more holistic manner, as well as avoid scam accounts.

Slice Analytics has never received funding, and our core team is entirely bootstrapped. Receiving retroactive funding for our work on Optimism and Base would be monumental in allowing us to continue to produce valuable free tools for the public.

bio: Nfts creator and cartoonist
contributionDescription:
Growth to the ecosystem and nft marketplace at large.

NFTs are also playing a vital role in developing decentralized applications (dApps), decentralized software programs that run on a blockchain. dApps have the potential to disrupt traditional industries and create new business models, and NFTs can be used to represent and authenticate various types of assets in these applications.

For example, NFTs could be used to represent and authenticate ownership of the virtual real estate in a virtual world or to represent and authenticate ownership of in-game items in a gaming dApp. The use of NFTs in dApps could lead to the development of new industries and opportunities for economic growth.
impactDescription: My NFTs can also enhance the value of digital collectables, such as virtual trading cards or in-game items. The ability to authenticate and verify ownership of these collectables can increase their rarity and value, and the use of NFTs can create a secondary market for these assets. This can lead to increased liquidity and value for these collectables and create new economic growth opportunities

bio: Borderless is tech not-for-profit tech arm of Crypto Smart raising devs for free
contributionDescription:
Our last Cipher session Onboarded 20 more University Students to learn Solidity, a programming language used to develop smart contracts, and is essential for the growth and adoption of the Optimism ecosystem.

By training these 20 people to learn Solidity for free, B<>rder/ess tech hub is providing a valuable resource to the community and helping to build a stronger foundation for the future of Optimism.

Here are some specific ways that B<>rder/ess developers programme benefits the Optimism ecosystem:

Increase the number of developers building on Optimism:

The more developers who know Solidity, the more applications and protocols can be built on Optimism.

Improve the quality of smart contracts on Optimism:

Creating a diverse community with devs in different parts of the world, Africa

contributionLinks.description: Our Progress Report on Solidity Students
Eth Nigeria Meet Up at B<>rder/ess hub

impactDescription:
IMPACT

Our training has some immediate impact for the Optimism ecosystem.

For example, the 20 people who complete their training will be able to start contributing to the Optimism ecosystem right away by building new applications and protocols, or by auditing existing code.

Here are some specific ways that our students contribute to the Optimism ecosystem:

1. Build new applications and protocols on Optimism

2. Audit existing smart contracts on Optimism for security vulnerabilities.
We also teach Cyber Security at B<>rder/ess so this would help web3 devs learn faster on securing vulnerabilities.

3. Educate others about Solidity and Optimism through blog posts, tutorials, and workshops.

Keep up with our progress report here: https://twitter.com/BorderlessDev

contributionDescription:
Contribution(s) to Optimism:

While we are a new protocol and have not yet deployed on Optimism, we are excited to bring our innovative technology to this Layer 2 solution. Our plans include seamless integration with Optimism to provide enhanced benefits to its growing user base.

Benefits to Optimism:

By integrating our protocol with Optimism, we aim to contribute to its ecosystem by attracting new users and projects. This partnership will expand Optimism's offerings, making it a more attractive choice for users seeking efficient and cost-effective solutions.

RetroPGF Allocation:

#🫡 Marketing
The Optimism Vision is big! And Visions this big need to be amplified by a diverse & aligned group to help make it real.

The Ambassadors program enables community members to create focused content to bring the Vision closer to reality. If you have a talent for writing, design or visuals, come get involved!

impactDescription:
Retroactive Public Goods Funding (RetroPGF) Round 3 will take place this fall and will distribute 30M OP to reward contributions that have supported the development and adoption of Optimism.

Badgeholders (voters in RetroPGF) need to be able to discover and vote on nominated projects. A good voting experience is core to supporting the work of badgeholders and ensuring an accurate RetroPGF process.  

Round 2 of RetroPGF put a high burden on the voting experience of badgeholders, requiring them to do a lot of manual work spreadsheets and forms.  This friction limited the overall accuracy of the RetroPGF round.

bio: Web3 Identity management platform supercharging ENS utility.
contributionDescription:
Namespace is a subname management platform that brings customized solutions for ENS name owners (DAOs, collections, communities, individuals, etc.) and offers features that customize the subname managing and selling experience. 

Our platform has started expanding to the Optimism network, aiming to leverage its low-cost environment to mint ENS subnames effectively and store minting preferences on the OP chain by incorporating Chainlink's CCIP, with an option for klaster.io CCIP, to ensure a seamless experience.

contributionLinks.description: Loom Demo - How to List and Issue Subnames with Namespace

impactDescription:
Subname Customization:
We've provided the Ethereum ecosystem with a structured naming system, offering 54 unique listed names at an average listing price of 0.16 ETH.

Economic Impact:
Our platform has facilitated the minting of 178 subnames, generating a total of 23.10 ETH. This not only adds economic value but also utility to the ethereum ecosystem.

User Engagement:
The average spend per wallet for minting is 0.075 ETH, and the average earning is 0.14 ETH, promoting both user engagement and economic activity within the community.

bio: Hard work , keep building
contributionDescription: The Optimism Collective will dispel the myth that public goods cannot be profitable. The Collective will consistently provide massive retroactive incentives for public goods which benefit Optimism, Ethereum, and the Collective as a whole. Growth which yields profit for the Collective and profit which funds more investment in public goods, all together producing a virtuous cycle of impact driven expansion.

The first and largest portal and aggregator for Autonomous Worlds and FOCGs
contributionDescription:
Composable Hub is the first and largest portal and aggregator for Autonomous Worlds(AWs) and Fully Onchain Games(FOCGs). The aggregator part is currently supporting Ethereum and Optimism only. 

Currently, FOCGs are in a very early stage, but many believe they have the greatest potential in the future. 

Many FOCG developers in this field need more user traffic. We have listed over 40 FOCG projects on our website, of which about 15% are on Optimism. We help them arrange their basic information, social media, asset data, and more, making it easier for players to find and understand.

We have also assisted many FOCG projects in playtests or tournaments, receiving very positive feedback in the community, thus we have established good relationships with many FOCG projects, including Lattice.

bio: I am 43 years old, living in Vietnam. I am a cryptocurrency investor since 2018.
contributionDescription: Op is an absolute favorite of mine. The ecosystem has the most advantages among L2.I will stand by OP for a long time, until one day OP explodes into the largest ecosystem. That's when the Layer 2 Optimism ecosystem started to explode.

contributionLinks.description: I have been actively supporting NFT music projects on OP.

impactDescription:
I have been actively supporting NFT music projects on OP. OP is an ecosystem with too many advantages. 
Scalability: Optimism can improve scalability by 10–100x, depending on the nature of the transaction.
Reduced transaction fees: Optimism can significantly reduce transaction costs. Rollup technology combines multiple transactions into a single transaction, helping to reduce transaction costs.
Security: As Optimism's Layer 2 is built on Ethereum, transactions are settled on the Ethereum Mainnet, allowing users to benefit from the secure and decentralized environment of Ethereum.
Enhanced user experience: New projects using the Optimism Layer 2 scaling solution benefit from low fees, faster transaction processing speeds, and better overall user experience.

bio: A fresher
contributionDescription: ఈ గైడ్‌లో, మీ ఆధార్ కార్డ్‌ని ఆన్‌లైన్‌లో ఎలా అప్‌డేట్ చేయాలో, సమీపంలోని ఎన్‌రోల్‌మెంట్ కేంద్రంలో ఏం డాక్యుమెంట్లు అడుగుతారో మీకు వివరంగా ఇవ్వబడింది. . అదనంగా, మేము నవీకరణ/దిద్దుబాటును ప్రాసెస్ చేయడానికి అవసరమైన రుసుమును కూడా ఈ శీర్షికలో పేర్కొన్నాము. అలాగే మద్దతు పత్రాల యొక్క సుదీర్ఘ జాబితాను కూడా ఇందులో జాబితా చేసాము, వీటిని ఆధార్ కార్డ్‌లోని వివరాలను నవీకరించడానికి చెల్లుబాటు అయ్యే డాక్యుమెంట్ ప్రూఫ్‌గా ఉపయోగించవచ్చు. ఈ మార్పుల తర్వాత కూడా మీ 12 అంకెల ఆధార్ కార్డ్ నంబర్ అలాగే ఉంటుంది.

bio: A coder with a difference
contributionDescription:
And we were going to build it. We needed a team.

So, we raised our first $3.5M from Paradigm shortly after releasing Unipig–the first ever rollup PoC, a collaboration with Uniswap–at Devcon V.

Ultimately, it’s taken years for the scalability endgame to come into clear view. But, to this day, the designs sit at the heart of Ethereum’s pragmatic, rollup-centric roadmap.

bio: Cryptocurrency Adoption Through The Influence Of The Optimism Ecosystem
contributionDescription:
The progress of global cryptocurrency adoption has faced challenges, primarily stemming from the scarcity of crucial information, limited access to educational resources, and lack of awareness regarding recent developments.

These significant factors have contributed to a perceived stagnation in the cryptocurrency space. In response to this, Cryptorist Hub was established under the influence of the Optimism Ecosystem, with the mission to promote awareness and provide widespread access to cryptocurrency education on Optimism and Optimism project in which most of the community members have in many ways benefited from it monetarily.
impactDescription: Cryptorist Hub serves as an expansive WhatsApp community comprising 1200+ passionate adopters. With its substantial membership, this community has significantly contributed to the growth of the Optimism Ecosystem. This support extends to various projects building on both Optimism and Optimism itself, making it a driving force behind the advancements within the Optimism ecosystem.

bio: An L2 for Autonomous Agents and DePIN projects
contributionDescription:
Stamp ⊙ is an OP Stack chain focused on serving digital entities such as AI agents, IoT devices, and robots. 

Starting from the heuristic that the future of work will be digital. These entities need to coordinate among themselves and with humans. We are developing the tooling and ecosystem for builders to create new protocols and dapps on top of Stamp.

Stamp aims to be a member of the Superchain. Following Optimism's model, we will use the sequencer's revenue to fund OSS to support digital entities and human prosperity.
impactDescription:
This initiative is still very much in alpha. Until now, the focus has been creating an ecosystem of partners to support the chain and researching tooling. This led to the start of two ongoing initiatives:
- RoboId: DID-based identifiers for digital entities. 
- Access Control: OCAPs (Object Capabilities) for advanced permissions with seamless integration with SIWE (Sign in With Ethereum).

Stamp is becoming the go-to solution for DePIN (Decentralized Physical Infrastructure Network) projects. Other blockchains are working on the DePIN vertical, such as Peaq on Polkadot, Helium on Solana, and IoTeX as its own L1. 

Accepted into Amsterdam Startup Booster to track bikes (https://senseable.mit.edu/bike-trafficking/) through a DePIN project we are working on called TraceMy.

Sprintcheckout is making assets usable as a currency, so users can actually buy real stuff with their crypto winnings.
Sprintcheckout is one of the pay crypto payment processors available on optimism.
To make crypto payments usable, one of the enablers is ERC4337 (Account Abstraction).
Sprintcheckout is working with AA Wallets like Candide to specify the way gasless, recurrent payments and rewards can be done on Optimism.
impactDescription:
Our Open source dapp is an example to other payment processors.
Two wordpress merchants are downloading our plugin per day.
There are more than 250 merchant accounts created.
Merchant are starting to process payments. We expect around  $50,000 in volume per month in the coming month.

impactDescription: RetroPGF 3 will distribute 30 million OP tokens to reward contributions that have supported the development & adoption of Optimism. Optimism is building an economy that empowers builders, creators, and educators to be recognized and rewarded for their contributions to the Collective. We do this by regularly funding any public goods that have demonstrated real impact to the community. To commemorate the announcement of RetroPGF 3, we’re releasing this OPen-edition NFT.

bio: A decentralized monitoring, reporting and verification (dMRV) system.
contributionDescription: To empower open source coders, Base offers initial contracts, and Code Connect helps onboard relevant methodologies for regenerative finance into Optimism. By incorporating decentralized monitoring, reporting, and verification (dMRV) of regenerative actions, such as tree planting for clean air, into Optimism, we support our goal of funding public good and enhance understanding of the technology's benefits. Connected methods are analyzed and stored in a data claim resolution NFT, designed for Filecoin's tech stack. Throughout development, we adhere to international standards like the Ecological Benefits Framework. Recently, we conducted a real-life dMRV trial for a land regeneration organization using a specialized tech stack from Athena Protocol, later with Althea connectivity devices.

contributionLinks.description: The organizational Github repository. Code related to dMeter is stored here.
This is the contract deployed on Base for Code Connect

impactDescription: Through dMeter we have channeled over 50k dollars’ worth of funding to open source coders creating a decentralized monitoring, reporting and verification (dMRV) system. This system has already been used by projects on the ground doing regenerative work and has plans to expand globally. By creating these mechanisms, we can further empower the Optimism tech stack for monitoring the profound impact public good funding has and the cascading benefits that result from it. The initlal codebases we have created, such as Code Connect and data claim resolution NFT, further empower Optimism’s tech stack for the use of regenerative finance projects.

fundingSources.description: From past Gitcoin rounds donated by different organizations.

bio: Optimeme  creates and promote optimism and superchain related memes.
contributionDescription:
Optimeme was created to spread positivity, optimism, and foster a sense of community through the creative and engaging medium of memes. We firmly believe in the power of humor and relatability and it use case in onboarding more users to the optimism ecosystem.

1. Meme Creation:  We curate a diverse range of memes that are both humorous and educative. Our team of creative minds work to craft content that resonates with a broad audience of optimism ecosystem. 

2. Meme Promotion: Our team employs strategic and ethical methods to share these memes across various social media platforms and communities.

3. Superchain-Related Memes:  In addition to spreading optimism, we also have a special focus on optimism "superchain" related content.
impactDescription:
Through our relentless dedication to creating and promoting optimism and superchain-related memes, we've had a significant impact on both individuals and the broader online community.

On the superchain front, our mission is to educate and inspire people about the immense potential of blockchain technology. We've seen a growing interest and awareness in the transformative power of superchains, as our meme content has helped demystify complex concepts and made them more accessible to a wider audience.

Our impact can be measured in engagement metrics, as well. Our memes have reached vast audience   across various social media platforms, sparking discussions, sharing knowledge, and creating a sense of community among those interested in both optimism and blockchain technology.

bio: Optimistica is a challenging 2D quest-adventure game!
contributionDescription:
Optimistica is a 2D adventure game with a unique atmosphere and an Optimism style, belonging to the "quest to earn" genre. The game is designed to bring unforgettable experiences to players in the Optimism ecosystem, featuring colorful 2D art styles and unique character designs. The game's storyline revolves around issues of optimism and self-improvement, providing players with an immersive and fulfilling experience. 

Optimistica not only aims to entertain players, but also to immerse them in a mysterious atmosphere through the game's special music, graphics, and story. Join the game's main character, Karl Optimist, on an exciting journey! 

Players who successfully complete the first quest will receive a limited edition NFT (200NFT).
impactDescription:
The game comprises a vast array of puzzles that help players enhance their logical and creative abilities. The intricate plot stimulates the players to embark on a long and fascinating journey through the game. As a reward for each completed quest, players receive incentives, which serve as a motivating factor to take on more quests. Additionally, a collection of 4 ranks of NFTs has been created to unlock access to more difficult quests and greater rewards.

We are currently attracting new players and users to the Optimism ecosystem and will continue to attract.

bio: Goverland is the Mobile App for all DAOs.
contributionDescription:
We've crafted a mobile app for DAO enthusiasts. Key highlights:
- Ease-of-Use: Our intuitive design promotes active DAO participation.
- Transparent Governance: We've made DAO decision-making clearer.
Our app is backed by extensive research on user engagement, utilizing public data from Snapshot. With a focus on delegate accountability—vital for Optimism—we've integrated Snapshot voting and are gearing up to add Governor contracts, enhancing mobile engagement in Optimism's governance. While the app is versatile for many DAOs, Optimism DAO gets special attention. Built without external grants, we aim to democratize DAO governance. Check out our TestFlight link below.
impactDescription: Our solution should bring new users to Optimism and increase the participation rate among current OP token holders, highlighting influential delegates, facilitating delegating stale tokens and re-delegating. We already did a lot of work to make it happen and will have a public launch in November. Now, our application is in a TestFlight Alpha.

impactMetrics.description: Existence of Mobile App for Optimism DAO

bio: Portuguese-language community dedicated to the Optimism ecosystem
contributionDescription:
Although Portuguese is the fifth most spoken language worldwide, there is a dearth of materials and content about Optimism in this language. However, we are here to change that and make Optimism more accessible to Portuguese speakers.

Our initiatives encompass the translation of articles and website documentation, the creation of original articles and posts, Twitter Spaces with various communities, fostering the growth of a community for Optimism in Portuguese, and other ideas that are still in the planning phase, such as IRL/virtual events and workshops.

In the end, we just want to help Optimism grow and reach more people through education and knowledge about Optimism, OP Stack & OP Collective.
impactDescription:
Our efforts are dedicated to long-term goals. We strongly believe that establishing a closer relationship with a web3 project in one's native language is crucial for enabling individuals to truly comprehend the Optimism Collective. Our primary goal is to continue supporting and inspiring people to delve deeper into the OP ecosystem.

We are committed to providing extensive content in Portuguese, whether through article translations, original creations, hosting Spaces with various communities and projects, fostering integration with Optimism and other Portuguese-speaking communities, and pursuing other initiatives.

Moreover, we have recently initiated a collaboration for the translation of Subli's - The Optimist, a newsletter dedicated to the Superchain.

bio: Center serves as a platform that brings together many games for OP Collective.
contributionDescription:
Optimism Gaming Center is the gaming hub of the Optimism ecosystem. Its primary objective is to provide a fun and engaging experience to the community, while also promoting community engagement.

Games, available at this time:
- Tokens Battle - is an online game that allows players to compete with their friends and become the king of the cryptocurrency world by playing for their favorite token!
- Red Sapper - is a retro-style game that has been given an optimistic twist. It is a game straight from the 90s, but with new and improved graphics and gameplay.
- 2048 - the center also offers the classic puzzle game, 2048. This game challenges the player's logic and strategic thinking skills as they try to merge tiles to reach the highest number possible.
impactDescription: Our platform is designed for people who want to enjoy their leisure time in a safe and enjoyable way. It provides a wide variety of familiar games that are easy to play, with an optimistic design that makes the experience even more enjoyable. We do not support casino-style gambling games, but we offer a range of other options that are equally fun and engaging. Despite not having any advertising campaigns, our platform has become popular among thousands of active users who appreciate the simplicity and accessibility of our platform.

impactDescription:
ptimism Collective is a large-scale experiment in "digital democracy governance" designed to foster the rapid and sustainable development of the decentralized ecosystem on Optimism.

Optimism Collective will be managed by the Optimism Foundation organization.

Optimism Collective comprises communities, projects, and citizens (referred to as citizens – meaning users), operating based on a mutually beneficial covenant, with the underlying principle being "impact = profit." This means that the more active and engaged we are, the greater the benefits we receive from the ecosystem.
We highly appreciate OP and have been sharing the project since the early days in the OP ecosystem.

bio: Soulcial is an AI-driven DeSocial Protocol to Redefining SocialFi to Empower All
contributionDescription:
Our protocol aims at web3 massive adoption, and based on the existing ecosystem and AI open-source models, we have already implemented the following product features.

Soulcial provides a multi-dimensional social evaluation model(SBTI) that creates your on-chain Soul Index, a digital reflection of your unique identity in the metaverse.

Our AI transforms your Social Behavior Trait Indicator (SBTI) into SoulCast NFTs. These NFTs represent your digital essence and can be seen as living stories.

Content creators can leverage their existing networks to enhance their SBTI without the need to produce additional content, while content consumers will find their diverse contributions to the Web 3 space reflected in their SBTI.
impactDescription:
We aim to attract over 50,000 users to use our dapp within 3 months, and 500,000 in a year. Every user can generate their exclusive social assets and connect to more soulmates in our project.

With a vision to revolutionize social networks, we have redefined the way social value is measured and rewarded, creating a groundbreaking social value indicator.

Rather than competing with existing SocialFi projects, we position ourselves as a complementary aid, facilitating content creators' passive growth of their social network and helping non-content creators gain the recognition they deserve for their value. We pledge to reward everyone for their unique roles and contributions to the Web 3 community.

bio: BBD is the ultimate destination for reliable, speculation-free blockchain news.
contributionDescription:
Our contribution to Optimism is multi-faceted and centered around fostering a more informed, connected, and trustworthy blockchain ecosystem.

Our commitment to education benefits end users by providing them with accurate and unbiased information. This knowledge empowers them to confidently engage with blockchain technologies, aligning with our aim to take the community away from Fear, Uncertainty, and Doubt (FUD) and bring them closer to reality.

Upholding ethical journalism standards also contributes to trust and transparency within the industry, making blockchain technologies, including Optimism, more accessible and appealing to end users.

contributionLinks.description: Badgeholders can learn more about our contributions on our official website.

impactDescription:
The contributions of the Blockchain Bytes Daily (BBD) significantly impact the Optimism Collective, nurturing a well-informed, engaged, and interconnected community. BBD offers valuable insights and education to the broader blockchain community, guiding users towards adopting blockchain technologies, including the latest OP stack chains and platforms built upon them. 

Upholding ethical journalism amplifies trust and transparency, bolstering the credibility of projects such as Optimism. 

Furthermore, our developer-centric coverage supports the expansion of the Optimism ecosystem. Overall, BBD has cultivated a more educated, engaged, and trustworthy blockchain environment, aligning with the goals of the Optimism Collective.

bio: An Indian immigrant wandering metaverse
contributionDescription: Ensuring the Bedrock release is as close to 100% Ethereum-equivalent as possible is good for developers in our community. Inheriting improvements from L1 will require much less lift from developers who work on Optimism at a protocol level. It will also reduce the load on the OP Labs engineering team and help them build with our community in mind. Minimally modified execution clients make it easy for us to stay up to date with Ethereum Mainnet changes as they are implemented.

Director Removal is the right of governance to remove a director of the Optimism Foundation.

Director Removals are approved by both the Token House and Citizens’ House. Stewards of the Optimism Foundation should be accountable to the entire community.

This right is enforced and upheld by the legal documents that underpin the Optimism Foundation’s commitment to the Collective. As Directors are not represented onchain, this responsibility does not have onchain enforceability.

bio: Product @cometdaox
contributionDescription: Governance minimization. The set of governance responsibilities that are encoded onchain or formalized in voting processes should remain as minimal as possible. The Collective aims to reduce governance to its essence and to avoid introducing regulation where freedom can achieve the same result. This principle is key to encouraging permissionless innovation. In practice, this looks like a minimal set of (1) onchain governance processes to upgrade Optimism contracts and tune the economic parameters of the system, and (2) offchain social processes to maintain a healthy community.

bio: 4 yrs in crypto fulltime
contributionDescription:
There are two primary goals of Optimism’s governance system:

Capture resistance. Governance plays a key role in securing the anti-capture and censorship resistance of the Optimism protocol. Governance should (a) make it possible for chain or network operation to continue without reliance on any individual entity, and (b) prevent any one entity or small group of entities from being able to control or censor the protocol or its functions.

Resource allocation. Governance’s second primary responsibility is to allocate resources effectively to support the Collective’s vision and accrue sustainable value to the Optimism Collective.

bio: A Kernel Student
contributionDescription: This two-house design is intended to help the Collective make good decisions and avoid common pitfalls in token-based governance systems. Tokenholders represent one constituency out of many, and are not always the right unilateral owners for decisions that don’t involve the economics of the system. Creating two distinct branches of governance with different membership criteria allows the Collective to match constituents’ incentives with different types of decisions. It also helps the Collective avoid concentration of power, enact safeguards via checks and balances, and evaluate decisions from broader perspectives.

contributionDescription:
Ensure blockspace remains homogeneous, neutral and open: A commitment to the Law of Chains is a commitment to the protection of a chain’s users, developers, and other stakeholders. Chains large and small, if part of the Superchain, can credibly demonstrate the homogenous, neutral and open properties of their blockspace, backed by Optimism Governance.

Benefit from constant improvement: Shared upgrades mean that chains can always get the best tech, without having to worry about maintenance themselves.

Enable better, more available infrastructure: Because all chains in the Superchain are credibly committed to a standard, they can work together to ensure the availability and affordability of key services like indexing and sequencing.

bio: Crypto learner and educator
contributionDescription:
Coinbase’s decision to build and incubate Base on the OP Stack was cause for palpable excitement. At the same time, it brought forth pressing questions:

How would introducing new chains shift the balance in Optimism’s economics?

How would OP Chains balance decentralization and neutrality with their own interests?

How could we remain unified in development efforts, and avoid fragmenting work?

We’d known that the day would come to transition from a single chain to a Superchain. But this made it real. Our journey to forge ahead with Base wasn't just about answering these questions; it was about setting a precedent.

bio: A fun loving girl from Texas
contributionDescription:
The Optimism Collective was born to dispel the myth that public goods cannot be profitable. The OP Stack is an MIT-licensed public good. Anyone can use or fork it however they see fit.

And yet, the benefits of a shared standard turn the incentive to fork into an incentive to coordinate, driving disparate chains to cohere into a collective network – the Superchain. By encoding a fee split into that shared standard, the original Optimistic Vision starts to emerge: sustainable funding for the open-source code that upholds an optimistic economy.

bio: Crypto trader
contributionDescription:
a multichain world brings its own challenges. Ethereum L2s are already pushing the limits of tooling and UX, and we are nowhere near global scale. To support the next hundreds, thousands, and millions of chains, we need a paradigm shift.

The reality is–as growing brands and ecosystems look for platforms to call home, they have limited, imperfect options. Large ecosystems like Coinbase are faced with a difficult decision: they can deploy on Ethereum and forfeit scalability, choose a single L2 and be dependent on that ecosystem, or deploy and maintain their own chain and fragment liquidity and network effects.

bio: A web3 enthusisast
contributionDescription:
Optimism was built to empower humanity through decentralized blockchain technology that enables unprecedented coordination of human intelligence across the globe, at scale. And there is a lot to celebrate: by our estimation, over the past two years, OP Mainnet has cumulatively saved users $2.69 billion in fees, 15.8 years of waiting for transaction confirmations, and currently secures $2.8 billion in onchain value.

But the reality is: nobody has truly scaled Ethereum. That includes us.

If Ethereum is to rival the goliaths of web2, and take software’s next bite of the world, it needs internet-level scale. No single chain today can offer that.

bio: Support Optimism developers & users in South Korea
contributionDescription:
At Optimism Korea, our primary focus is breaking language barriers and cultivating the Korean Optimism builder community.

Translation: Language remains a formidable challenge for non-English-speaking builders. We're addressing this by translating all developer documentation and Mirror on Optimism's blogs into Korean. This initiative empowers developers and users to grasp Optimism's vision and actively contribute.

Builder Community: We've initiated the formation of an Optimism builder community, starting with our team of 8 experienced Optimism developers. Additionally, we plan to organize Developer Meetups to welcome newcomers.

Our contributions are geared towards empowering and expanding Optimism's presence in the Web3 ecosystem while bridging language gaps.

bio: Mode Domains provides “.mode” handles for the Mode Blockchain community.
contributionDescription:
Mode Domains is a decentralized naming system created on the Mode blockchain. It uses smart contracts to manage domain name registration, renewal, and resolution. It manages domains in a decentralized way, enhancing registration and resolution performance.

Thus, we allow users to claim personalized '.mode' handles for their blockchain addresses, simplifying blockchain use for a wider audience.

We allocate fees from Mode Domains to back Optimism Collective and Mode's growth. The rest funds project development and integration.

As Mode Network grows, it boosts demand for Optimism's layer 2 solutions with more users and developers. 

Overall, Mode Domains and Mode Network's growth fuels OP Stack and Optimism Collective, creating a positive feedback loop of development.

contributionLinks.description: Badgeholders can learn more about our contributions on our website.
Github repo link for Mode Domains.
Twitter account link for Mode Domains.

impactDescription:
One big impact is that many people have started using Mode Domains, and we have more than 28,000 people who claimed their own '.mode' addresses, which brought in a lot of new users, creating a more diverse and engaged community that's vital for the Optimism ecosystem.

We have a great community with 962 Twitter followers. This helps more people know about what we're doing and work together within the Optimism ecosystem. So, in short, what we do for the OP Stack with Mode Domains is make things better for users, get more people to use it, and work closely with the community to help the Optimism ecosystem become more efficient, secure, and successful.

bio: Exploring decentralized onchain music curation
contributionDescription:
MusicTribes pioneers the mode of interaction within the Optimism music ecosystem, bridging artists, collectives, and fans.

It aggregates NFTs from platforms like Sound.xyz, Catalog, Zora, Lens and others. Unlike traditional platforms, recommendations are defined externally by tokenized communities' input parameters. Users get content based on the community tokens they hold, avoiding conventional algorithm-driven models and fostering direct artist-to-fan engagement. This empowers artists and utility for community members, with the potential for communities to earn referral fees. Most communities have minted their tokens on the Optimism blockchain. 

Music Tribes also incorporates artists' Mirror articles, integrating another OP platform.

impactDescription:
With onchain collecting, it not only satisfies my passion for collecting but also supports artists on their journey to bring their products to the blockchain. This contributes to changing the general perception of a new revolution for all of us, from ordinary users to creators.

Especially the development of L2s, typically the OP chain with outstanding scalability, fast speed, low cost and extremely user-friendliness, helps me easily own works of unique digital art, creating a fun collecting experience and also a way for me to support artists and their work. By purchasing NFTs, I help create a more equitable income stream for artists than the traditional web2 method, giving them steady resources to focus on creating higher quality products.

bio: FairSharing aims to create a new way of collaboration and resource allocation.
contributionDescription:
FairSharing aims to reshape the way human collaborate and distribute rewards within a decentralized, remote-first, digital era.

Deployed on Optimism Mainnet and Testnet (Optimism Goerli), FairSharing is able to support various projects & DAOs in the Optimism ecosystem to ensure that contributions are transparently visible and rewards are distributed equitably.

Each individual contributor will also own their contributions fully on-chain, which in terms can enhance their willingness of participation.

Overall, FairSharing could foster a more transparent, equal, and trusted culture of decentralized collaboration.
impactDescription:
FairSharing has leveraged the Web3 native protocol EAS (Ethereum Attestatioin Service). By deeply collaborating with DAOstar, FairSharing is pushing forward the EAS standard formulation as public goods among DAOs and projects, which drives wider awareness and adoption of EAS (Attestation on OP).

As a public goods tool itself, FairSharing not only makes it easier for individuals to record, measure and show their contribution in a more transparent way, but also facilitates DAOs & projects to track & monitor contribution from each contributor and allocate resources & rewards equitably.

FairSharing is able and willing to be further integrated into Optimism Collective to track & monitor the contribution progress and builder participation of grants-winning projects.

bio: Dunia ini Fana!
contributionDescription:
The core idea behind retroPGF is to level the playing field between profit-maximizing startups and nonprofit/OSS projects. Profit-seeking entities have an advantage in their potential for an exit, drawing early investment funding and providing incentives for employees. The goal of retroPGF is to create a system that provides the same benefits for nonprofit and OSS projects.

One of the most difficult parts of retroPGF is creating a “results oracle” — the process that decides which projects receive an exit. We want to experiment with many iterations to refine this mechanism, and today, we are embarking on the first.

bio: Bored Town, a nurturing ecosystem where creativity meets innovation.
contributionDescription:
Bored Town is not just an NFT art community; it's a hub of innovation, support, and artistic growth. With a solid commitment to fostering talent and nurturing the world of NFT art, we've embarked on an exciting journey of empowerment. Thanks to a recent governance grant, we've hosted an exceptional art contest and established our launchpad to showcase participating artists' works.

Our unique approach involves incubating artists from the ground up, regardless of their technical know-how. We provide the knowledge, tools, and nurturing environment for them to thrive. This creates a supportive and safe space for both artists and art enthusiasts within our community. In Bored Town, our members can explore the potential of Optimism Stack while enjoying high-quality art from genuine creators.

impactDescription:
Our progress so far includes 46,000 followers on X, 18,700 Discord members, and over 20 collections across various blockchains, primarily on Optimism, engaging with 28,800+ wallets.

We maintain strong partnerships with protocols like Galxe, Guild.xyz, Clique, QuestN, and Opti.domains. We offer support to around 200 artists from our art contest, with several successfully launching their debut NFT collections on Optimism and OP Stack through our launchpad, receiving exceptional community support.

To date, we've nurtured 8 collections, each with a supply of up to 35k, all minted in less than 2 hours during public events. Our community members consistently receive rewards for minting, holding NFTs, and participating in art contest voting.

bio: I am held hostage by binji, forcing me to sign up. HELP ME
contributionDescription:
Let me be clear: I've done absolutely nothing worth a retroactive reward. 

Zilch, nada, zero.

Why am I here? The story begins with a strange man called binji.

I was minding my own onchain business, trying to use Defisaver for flashloan arbitrage. Ask about that topic in their Discord, they love it. 

Suddenly, a black smoke screen filled the room. I could not see anymore. But I could smell the distinctive scent of phoenix ashes mixed baby tears. This could mean only one thing: after all these years, binji caught up with me.

"Sign up for PGF3!" he said. "or else..."

"Or else what?" I asked.

But he was gone just as fast as he appeared. Still, despite his departure a sense of impending doom lingered. One does not defy the Optimism Collective. I had to comply with his demands.

contributionLinks.description: A NFT collection where the data is randomly pulled from other NFT collections
This is the WETH contract. It's not mine but you've got to admit it's a nice one
Including Zombo here just in case you missed it in my profile. Great to relax
Bulkminter. Unverified state will forever testify of my struggles w/ Etherscan
This is binji's Twitter. He's responsible for everything. Tread carefully
Basepaint contract. Not mine. They're awesome. Hope they get PGF3
Bing Create lets you make images with DALL-E 3. Pretty fun to use
I don't think there's any check in those input fields.
At this point, I'm wondering if there's a limit to the number we can submit?
At 80 characters, it's more cumbersome than tweets, but perhaps a poem would do.
In fields of green, where hope is sown, A phoenix rises, feathers blown.
From ashes, it takes flight, A symbol of optimism, shining bright.
Its plumage, red as the sun, A color bold, a spirit won.
For optimism is not just a thought, But a heart that's been through the fought.
It's the belief in a brighter day, A future where fears fade away.
It's the courage to face each test, And rise again, like the phoenix' best.
With wings of red, it soars on high, A beacon of light, touching the sky.
It casts a shadow, a shade so bright, Bringing warmth, dispelling the night.
Optimism, a virtue we hold dear, A beauty that banishes all fear.
It's the fire that burns deep inside, A flame that flickers, never dies.
For in the face of every strife, Optimism offers us a life.
A life where hope and love reside, A world where we all can thrive.
So let us embrace this virtue, And let it guide us, as we endeavor.
For with optimism, we'll find our strength,
And rise again, like the phoenix at length.
Parting words: Tron Legacy was a great movie.
DM me your address and I'll send you a NFT.
I will accept no more and no less than 0.42 OP for this work of art.
...if this doesn't go through! I guess I could take a screenshot for myself.
Perhaps the Optimism collective could hire me for sanity checks.
In all fairness, I'm not quite sane myself.
I sent 1 OP to 0xb0b0. If you're the first to read this, you can claim it.
All in all, Optimism is a great project and I hope you got a kick out of this.

bio: Optiland Quests - onboarding users to Optimism
contributionDescription:
Optimistic Bunnies is the first NFT on Optimism featuring original artwork. The project has made significant contributions to the Optimism ecosystem through our Learn and Earn quests and Coinbase wallet quest.

Our weekly Learn to Earn quests encouraged participants to learn a different protocol every week in the broader OP ecosystem.  The learning topics included protocols in the defi, NFTs, bridges, wallets, onramp, and tools categories. The program produced around 400 power users of the Optimism ecosystem.

We were also invited by Coinbase to produce an artwork that was featured as part of the Coinbase wallet quests. This initiative provided a large net positive in helping onboard 25,000 Coinbase Wallet users onto Optimism, creating a positive impact on the entire Optimism system.

contributionLinks.description: Coinbase Wallet Quest - Fall of Sybil
Learn and Earn quest grant application

impactDescription:
Our activities contribute towards a healthy and engaging sector in the NFT space directly, and indirectly to the Optimism protocols we promote.  Our learn and earn program created around 400 power users who are familiar with various dApps in the OP ecosystem.  We had around 2,600 submissions and 2,100 approved submissions.  15 Optimism projects benefited from the additional exposure from quests.

Our Coinbase wallet quest - Fall of Sybil, had around 25,000 mints since launch.  It onboarded 25,000 Coinbase users to Optimism.  The collection has around 97% unique owners.  Coinbase distributed roughly $122,000 in $OP to the quest participants directly.  The additional users onboarded through the quest provided a net positive to the entire OP ecosystem.

fundingSources.description: 20000 $OP grant given entirely to quest participants

bio: Searching opportunities
contributionDescription:
I was part of a project to develop a web-based application for a university. My team was tasked with creating a web-based application that would allow students to easily check their grades, register for courses, pay fees, and access other university resources. My primary role in the project was to create the user interface (UI) and user experience (UX) of the application. This involved researching current trends in web-based applications, creating wireframes and mockups of our ideas, and then implementing those designs into HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
I also worked closely with the back-end developers to ensure that the UI/UX I was creating was compatible with their code.

bio: Zonic is a "Superchain-compatible" NFT Marketplace made for optimal efficiency.
contributionDescription:
Zonic has significantly bolstered the Optimism network, becoming a frontrunner in the NFT arena. Our high-liquidity NFT marketplace serves as a central hub, simplifying exchanges for creators, traders, and artists. This eliminates the need for custom in-app NFT marketplaces, making the experience more user-friendly.

We've also championed artists, helping them display their work on Optimism, enriching the platform's diversity. This has spiked transaction volumes, energizing the ecosystem.

Beyond just a marketplace, we've introduced captivating activities on Optimism, drawing more users and enhancing its stature among NFT aficionados.

Lastly, our dedicated Discord community stands ready to assist users, ensuring a smooth NFT journey on Optimism for everyone.

contributionLinks.description: Our NFT Marketplace smart contract is open sourced

impactDescription:
Zonic has enriched the Optimism ecosystem through both B2C and B2B2C approaches. While our B2C initiatives are detailed elsewhere, we also support businesses leveraging the full OP stack.

For B2B2C, we guide entities looking to integrate an NFT marketplace within their blockchain using the OP stack.

Anticipating the growth of Layer-2 networks, we understood that building a thriving ecosystem around them is challenging. Hence, Zonic introduced a "Superchain-compatible" NFT Marketplace, streamlining integration for businesses.

Recently, we've quickly integrated blockchains like Base Goerli, Base Mainnet, and Zora. Notably, Base Goerli was incorporated just an hour after its launch, highlighting our proactive approach and the value we add to the OP stack ecosystem.

impactMetrics.description: Optimism, Base unique wallet on Zonic

fundingSources.description: We collected 2.5% marketplace fee for each sell made on the platform

bio: I love Optimism
contributionDescription: Once upon a time there was a sweet little girl. Everyone who saw her liked her, but most of all her grandmother, who did not know what to give the child next. Once she gave her a little cap made of red velvet. Because it suited her so well, and she wanted to wear it all the time, she came to be known as Little Red Riding Hood. One day her mother said to her: "Come Little Red Riding Hood. Here is a piece of cake and a bottle of wine. Take them to your grandmother. She is sick and weak, and they will do her well. Mind your manners and give her my greetings. Behave yourself on the way, and do not leave the path, or you might fall down and break the glass, and then there will be nothing for your sick grandmother.
impactDescription: Little Red Riding Hood promised to obey her mother. The grandmother lived out in the woods, a half hour from the village. When Little Red Riding Hood entered the woods a wolf came up to her. She did not know what a wicked animal he was, and was not afraid of him. "Good day to you, Little Red Riding Hood." - "Thank you, wolf." - "Where are you going so early, Little Red Riding Hood?" - "To grandmother's." - "And what are you carrying under your apron?" - "Grandmother is sick and weak, and I am taking her some cake and wine. We baked yesterday, and they should give her strength." - "Little Red Riding Hood, just where does your grandmother live?" - "Her house is a good quarter hour from here in the woods, under the three large oak trees.

bio: i am a trader in crypto
contributionDescription:
The Optimism Collective believes that building public goods should be rewarded.

This key ingredient to the Optimistic vision (opens new window)is more than just altruism – it’s core to our success. Optimism’s codebase itself is an open-source project, and builds on the shoulders of countless OSS giants which came before it.

This means public goods funding is a critical growth strategy. For Optimism, well-funded public goods means better developer tooling, widespread user education, safer infrastructure, and industry-leading research. It means Optimism can last and thrive.

Once we show that this model can drive a successful economy for the Optimism Collective, we can scale the principle of impact = profit to the world!
impactDescription:
Real impact stems from passion, a love for what you do.
Fix the problem in front of you, together. → Chances are if you have a problem, someone else has that problem as well. Let’s fix it together! What caused the problem? How do you fix it, and can we work together to fix it for everyone else?
Do it with optimism. → Be kind, patient and optimistic in everything you do.
Most importantly, make sure that your contributions align with the Collective Intents (opens new window). This will help ensure that your contribution is working towards a larger goal of the Collective.

bio: The NFT artist introducing Optimism blockchain to Layer1 and Web2 business.
contributionDescription:
I am a graphic designer, writer, and entrepreneur passionate about art. In June 2021, I embarked on my journey as an NFT artist, and it eventually became my full-time occupation, with my projects primarily on the Ethereum blockchain.

In June 2022, I launched my first project on Optimism, recognizing it as an ideal platform for NFTs due to its lower gas fees. I leveraged NFTs to promote businesses and events, using my art and marketing initiatives to attract new users to Optimism. As both an artist and the founder of a pioneering project on Optimism, my work garnered attention from companies and projects in the web2 realm, allowing me to introduce them to the world of Web3 through Optimism Stack.

bio: Automation tools that keep check your Health factor on Lending Protocol
contributionDescription: Liquildless has solved a pressing DeFi issue by providing real-time health factor notifications, safeguarding users on Optimism from liquidation in Aave, Compound, and Radiant. Our tool serves all Optimism users, enhancing safety and asset protection without making future promises.
impactDescription:
Liquildless has emerged as a pioneering solution on Optimism and Base by addressing a critical performance gap. Notably, Aave, a prominent lending protocol, lacked any notification service on these platforms.

 In stark contrast, Liquildless has stepped in to provide a vital service that empowers users with real-time notifications. While our project is in its early stages, we've already set the groundwork to fill this essential void, ensuring Aave users and the broader DeFi community can access crucial notifications to safeguard their assets effectively.

contributionDescription:
[RetroPGF 3](https://community.optimism.io/docs/governance/retropgf-3/) will allocate 30m OP tokens to ****reward contributions that have supported the development and adoption of Optimism. 

Every type of developer and contributor is eligible for RetroPGF. It doesn’t matter if you’re building a consumer app, a key piece of infra that Optimism pays for, or a free-to-use community tool that Optimists love. **If you’re providing impact, you are eligible!**

Your application will be used by badgeholders to decide on how much OP you should receive **based on the impact you already had on the Optimism Collective**. We recommend you take time to fill out your application and start early.

bio: Building composable tools to measure, evaluate, and certify impact.
contributionDescription: We are launching ImpactScribe, a permissionless protocol for minting Impact Certificates. ImpactScribe allows users to mint ERC-721 NFT Impact Certificates with ERC-6551 token bound accounts. Users can generate Claims of Impact (Hypercerts) and Proof of Impact NFTs stored in the token bound account. Deresy & Insightful are a composable set of tools to measure and evaluate quantitative and qualitative impact. Deresy is a review and evaluation protocol that generates Proof of Impact attestations on EAS and mints these evaluations as NFTs. It can be used to provide written evaluations of projects and images, video, audio or other documents. Insightful connects IoT devices and data streams to NFT dashboards to quantify impact using w3bstream, zk proofs and ceramic.
impactDescription: We are building on Optimism because we believe our evaluation tools could be used as a part of future rounds of the RetroPGF program. Based on talking with some badge holders the review process evolves each round. While our protocol has yet to be fully deployed to mainnet, we are targeting a launch before the end of the year. We have employed six developers who are now building on Optimism. We are working closely with Hypercerts Protocol to become the evaluation layer for Hypercerts, a Claim of Impact. We are talking to Gitcoin and other grantmakers who can use our tools to verify grantee impact. We are designing funding mechanisms for the impact certificates to drive additional users to OP. Receiving RetroPGF will support our team as we continue to add value to Optimism.

bio: Our mandate is to make the grants process smoother for everyone involved!
contributionDescription:
Season 4 has been an inflection point for the grants program, during which the review process went from a system that worked in theory to a system that is strengthened by practice.

On average, the Cycles in Season 4 saw a nearly 30% increase in proposals relative to Season 3 Cycles. There were more than 350 total proposals processed by the Grants Council in Season 4, relative to approximately 150 proposals processed in Season 3.

The Council scaled its process to accommodate the growing demand for Optimism grants. Each sub-committee refined rubrics tailored to the goal of Intent 2 (Innovating on Novel Applications), and the reviewers learned how to provide robust, yet efficient reviews to manage substantial growth.  We also piloted demand-based granting through the RFG program.
impactDescription: The council was able to create a more streamlined and consistent process for proposers, set a pace for grant distributions, and define clear expectations for grant applicants.  The council was able to generate meaningful requests for grants that ranged from audit services and RPC capacity to cross chain interoperability research.  Overall, the grants council has reduced the workload of Token House delegates, enabling them to focus their energies on high-impact votes.

impactMetrics.description: Number of proposals reviewed in season 4

fundingSources.description: 5 Base Reviewers - 25,000 each
3 Specialty Managers - 30,000, 1 Lead - 35,000 (+additional 10k btw S3 /S4)
2,250 - per council member for milestones review between S4/S5
Amounts above include only Season 4

contributionDescription:
Help Support 

Dear Friends and Supporters,

We hope this message finds you well. As many of you know, our local animal shelter has been a safe haven for abandoned and mistreated animals in our community for over a decade. We are writing to request your support in our fundraising efforts to continue providing care and shelter to these animals in need.

With gratitude,
praizmek
impactDescription:
Our shelter's mission is to rescue, rehabilitate, and rehome animals, ensuring they find loving and forever homes. We rely on the generosity of individuals like you to keep our doors open and continue our work.

Your contribution can make a significant difference in the lives of these animals. Here are a few ways you can help:

One-time Donation: You can make a one-time monetary contribution to our shelter. Every dollar counts and goes directly toward animal care, vaccinations, food, and shelter maintenance.

 Monthly Pledges:Consider becoming a monthly donor to provide stable, ongoing support. Monthly pledges help us plan for the long-term care of our animals.

bio: What I say Thats I Do
contributionDescription: BuidlGuidl helps onboard and educate new developers to the Ethereum ecosystem with teaching materials and tools to help them hit the ground running. bio: Crypto channel manager
contributionDescription:
Optimism is working to change outcomes for public goods contributors.

Retroactive public goods funding (RetroPGF) is Optimism’s process for funding public goods for the benefit of the Collective and beyond.
RetroPGF 3 will fund contributions that have supported the development and adoption of Optimism. Whether code or community, any public good that makes the OP Stack thrive can be elegible for RetroPGF.
impactDescription:
The Optimism Collective is a band of companies, communities, and citizens working together to reward public goods and build a sustainable future for Ethereum. There are many ways you can contribute to the Optimism Collective, depending on your skills, interests, and goals. Here are some of the possible options:


- If you are a developer, you can help build and improve the OP Stack, which is a modular, open-source blueprint for highly scalable, highly interoperable blockchains of all kinds. You can also create and deploy applications on Optimism Mainnet, which is the flagship implementation of the OP Stack. You can find more information and resources on the Optimism Docs and the GitHub repository.

bio: Exploring DAO Governance Experience
contributionDescription:
My contributions aims to participate in increasing DOA Governance Experience inside the Optimism DAO as well as inside the ecosystem as i deeply believe it's a key factor of DAO success.
- Initiation of the KeyMaker Project to improve Governance experience by providing Telegram notifications (including Gcal reminder setup, proposal summary, links) and daily alerts on X about beginning and end of proposals votes of Optimism DAO as well as other DAOs in the ecosystem.
- Contribution to "Review Ecosystem Contributions Issue Template" to simplify the understanding of awaited answer format to open issues as well as better context.
- Proposal to "Ecosystem Contributions Dashboard" to streamline the understanding of available contribution opportunities by leveraging Charmverse tool and API.
impactDescription: For the moment and due to low adoption impact remain low, however first feedbacks are highlighting that providing efficient tools which increase DAO governance experience will increase global participation. First hint is the growing audience reached by daily reminder on proposal on X

bio: I'm a crypto trader
contributionDescription:
When a user transacts on OP Mainnet, the profits generated from network sequencing are used to fund public goods through RetroPGF. Better public goods means more development, which creates more revenue that can be directed to public goods.

This round will focus on funding contributions that have supported the development and adoption of Optimism.
impactDescription:
The Optimism Collective believes that building public goods should be rewarded.

This key ingredient to the Optimistic vision (opens new window)is more than just altruism – it’s core to our success. Optimism’s codebase itself is an open-source project, and builds on the shoulders of countless OSS giants which came before it.

This means public goods funding is a critical growth strategy. For Optimism, well-funded public goods means better developer tooling, widespread user education, safer infrastructure, and industry-leading research. It means Optimism can last and thrive.

impactDescription: Retroactive public goods funding is advantageous because it is relatively easy to agree on what is useful, and see who built it. It is a lot harder to identify in advance what will be useful, and which team will do the best job of building it. The possibility of an eventual exit payment can also encourage investors to fund initial public good development efforts until the usefulness is obvious, in the same way that the possibility of an eventual IPO or buy out encourages investors to fund startups today

bio: love my self
contributionDescription:
Every type of developer and contributor is eligible for RetroPGF. It doesn’t matter if you’re building a consumer app, a key piece of infra that Optimism pays for, or a free-to-use community tool that Optimists love. **If you’re providing impact, you are eligible!**

Your application will be used by badgeholders to decide on how much OP you should receive **based on the impact you already had on the Optimism Collective**. We recommend you take time to fill out your application and start early.

**Note**: You are only evaluated based on the impact you already had. Do not mention or allude to your future work or future impact. This is **retroactive** public goods funding, not proactive funding!
impactDescription:
Badgeholders must understand how much OP, revenue, or funding you have already received for their contributions. This allows RetroPGF to fairly compensate impact to the Collective.

**The more accurate this information is, the more likely you will receive the right amount of RetroPGF.** You only need to add information about grants or revenue related to the contributions you’re looking to receive RetroPGF for.

- List funding and grants that directly or indirectly relate to your contribution
    - Did you receive a grant for your contribution?
    - Did users pay for your contribution?
    - Did you receive donations for your contribution?
- If you received a grant from the Token House (Missions, grants council, etc.), you must report this under the “Governance fund”
